Felipe Erias

Issie Lapowsky

Unlock the Power of Your Frontend Logs with LogDNA â€” Frontend developers can easily ingest browser logs, collect the diagnostic data that they need to understand when and why the user experience is degraded, and view browser data in context with other services (both on the client and serverÂ side).

LogDNA sponsor

Adrian Bece

Using HSL Colors in CSS â€” A handy primer that explains what HSL is, and how to use it, along with some useful use-cases and examples that you can use right away in your currentÂ projects.

  • As mentioned above, Firefox 90 is now available and it supports Fetch Metadata Request Headers which allow web apps to protect themselves against various cross-origin threats.

In JavaScript, attaching an event listener to constantly fire on scroll can be performance-intensive. Thereâ€™s a better way with IntersectionÂ Observer.

Michelle Barker
